about_the_game:
SCP: Hours to Go is a small survival horror escape room game based on the SCP Foundation Wiki. A catastrophic event shuts down the facility, leaving you alone in the security room with roaming hostile anomalous entities called SCPs. You can solve escape room puzzles and contain the loose SCPs to escape, or survive for as long as possible for a high score.

Puzzles in the small walkable area give a way to escape the facility. Doing this and containing the loose SCPs wins the game. Separate from winning, the game keeps a score from both time alive and encounters with SCPs. A score and high score are given at death or escape.

SCPs you'll find:

  • SCP-049 - Plague Doctor : A slow-moving aggressive entity that can kill you on touch. Disorient it with lavender gas, accessible with the camera system.
  • SCP-280 - Eyes in the Dark : An aggressive entity that appears during random blackouts. Shine your flashlight to disorient it, and reset the electricity to make it temporarily disappear.
  • SCP-131 - The "Eye Pods" : Specifically SCP-131-B, the passive entity can be called by a button and can be moved around.
  • SCP-173 - The Sculpture : Stays still whenever watched, but is able to move whenever it's not. This aggressive entity requires close attention.
  • SCP-106 - The Old Man : Loose in the facility, this aggressive entity can appear anywhere whenever it wishes.
  • SCP-525 - Eye Spiders : Specifically SCP-525-1, they appear randomly alongside normal spiders, but don't seem aggressive.
Containment of these need to be solved and/or are revealed through puzzles.

  • Processor: 2.0 GHz Processor or better
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Decent integrated graphics
  • Storage: 2 GB available space

Recommended:
  • OS: Any 64-bit distribution that has Vulkan
  • Processor: 3.0 GHz Processor or better
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GTX 1060 / AMD RX 570
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
